description:
I live super nearby and am always in the mood for Parker. I literally just got back from China and it was my first real meal off the plane... that amazing. 

I'm basic and obsessed with the quinoa bowls, but have ordered just about everything and am never disappointed. 

Quick and easy - have wine options (important) - friendly staff and healthy options. 

A must.
author: Samantha P.

description:
Really healthy, good food. Nice variety. A little pricey but worth it. Great vibes; great service; welcoming staff; happy customers, quite a few regulars. 

It's all good - sandwiches, salads, veggie bowls, smoothies, juices, beer, coffee, tea. Increasing and creative variety of artisan-quality cookies/desserts. Soups are outstanding when available. 

Works well for meaties, veggies and vegans. Indoor and outdoor dining. Excellent tartines - and they'll slice the very good bread thick or thin. Courteous and accommodating on substitutions.

Closes middle of the afternoon on weekends but open to 9 pm on weeknights. Counter or table service. 

.
author: David G.

description:
We didn't want to wait for plow so we ended up here. 

Really nice looking place with friendly staff. The menu's pretty straightforward brunch food. I got the potato hash with the carnitas+tomatillo ($13) which was a hefty meal. 

The potatoes are thickly cut and seasoned with quite a bit of heat on it. The carnitas were sprinkled on top and supplemented the potatoes well, but I didn't think it was particularly memorable. The poached egg was cooked *perfectly* which I always appreciate. That said, I would suggest splitting this bowl and another dish with a friend-- the serving size of the potatoes were huge and hard to finish.
author: Tien L.

description:
I liked this place. The person behind the counter was super nice. I ordered the egg muffins and she let me substitute out the potatoes and the bread (for avocado and a salad). I told her I was going to order a coffee later, when my friend arrived, and she said if I wanted I could pay now and she'd make it when they got here - she said she'd keep a close eye on people coming in and she stayed true to her word, I didn't even have to ask her. The egg muffins were good, to be honest, I was starving and so I was happy to eat almost anything. 

The place was a little warm inside, I didn't realize this until I stepped outside and realized it was colder outside than it was inside (and it was a hot day). Overall, a nice little spot to stop by if you're hungry and in the area.
author: Katie Y.

description:
Came here for lunch and the two of us ordered:

Quinoa Bowl with Avocado ($10 + $3)
This was a hot bowl of quinoa with a small cuts of mushrooms, onions, and an egg. (I expected this to be a cold dish, but I was pleasantly surprised.) It reminded me of a fried rice dish. The addition of avocados was nice but the $3 surcharge was a bit steep for the amount we got.

Heirloom Tomato Tartine ($14)
The tartine was one slice of bread that had a moderate layer of pesto topped with two tomato slices, healthy amount of burrata, and a drizzle of balsamic vinegar. This dish was extremely good: the bread was well toasted, the tomatoes were fresh, the burrata was plenty, and the pesto well seasoned. The addition of the balsamic really brought all these ingredients together. I would highly recommend this.

A great lunch spot if you're looking for something light with great, awesome flavors. The only downside is it was a bit high on the price side for what we got. Will definitely go back, just unfortunate I can't go too often.
author: Hongsuk S.

description:
Cute little cafe with sleek modern interiors reminiscent of minimalistic IKEA design. The ambiance here is welcoming and friendly. The service here is no fuss and you pay at the counter. 

We ordered the Chicken Salad Tartine and it is so good! The thick flavors and texture of the chicken salad perfectly balanced the crunchy neutral baked bread underneath.

Overall would recommend for a quick brunch/lunch.
author: Ella C.

description: Delicious flavorful food, healthy options and good portions! Very nice staff! Gotta try it!!
author: Kris E.

description: Fantastic!! Got poached eggs and side of potatoes. Delish!! This is definitely a hidden gem in Potrero Hill, without the 1 hr wait for breakfast like others down the street!
author: K. N.

description: I came here on a Sunday afternoon for some dranks. We sat by the window and stayed a little past closing (sorry! and thank you for not rushing us). I love this cute and simple place. I'll be back for happy hour for half off wine!
author: Annie S.

description:
Really excellent little neighborhood brunch place. 

I really loved the quinoa bowl, which is a hefty little dish chock full of turkey bacon, mushrooms, and topped with a poached egg and feta. I would have liked more kale, and fewer red pepper flakes though. 

Weird observations: 
- We came around 2pm on a Saturday and they were completely out of potatoes :D
- No mirror in the bathroom!
author: Mary F.

description: I stumbled upon this place. I was headed to a different place for breakfast/brunch but when I drove past it was empty AF so I decided to keep driving and end up somewhere else. I parked the car and saw Parker on the corner of 18th and Missouri. I am glad that I chose this spot. It's nice, the food is tasty and it doesn't break the pockets. The service is awesome. The fella that takes your order acknowledges everyone and had great recommendations. I love a place that knows its menu. But what really took it from 3 stars to 4 stars was the music that they were playing. Prolly dating myself but the song "Young Hearts Run Free" by Candi Staton came on and it reminded me of dancing around my house with my mother back in da day.....Aayyyeee. The tunes kept gettin Betta......not to mention I love a French Accent....aight I am busted I love any accent. Gawd me and my cheap thrills. Highly recommend!!!!!
author: Stacie J.

description:
I had really high hopes for Parker, and might have just gotten the wrong dishes here but the food was really underwhelming and plain. 

The setup of the cafe is cute and modern. There's bar seating and just a few small tables for two. It doesn't seem to get too crowded so if you gave up waiting for Plow, it's a good option. 

Brunch is served until 3 PM. For the most part, they have tartines using sourdough bread from Jane Bakery. I was a bit sad to find there were not a lot of GF friendly options so we opted for the Quinoa Bowl & smoothies.

Quinoa Bowl ($9) Kale, mushroom, onion, turkey bacon, feta, red pepper flakes, poached egg. Honestly tasted extremely basic and plain. Most of the bowl was just quinoa and I was hoping for more of the other listed ingredients. The bacon was not that great and came in tiny little slices too. The egg was poached nicely but that was about it. Super overpriced and don't recommend getting!

Almond Butter Tartine ($6) - Honey, cinnamon, fresh fruit, chia seeds. Tasted good but not great.

Green Butter Smoothie ($10) - Almond milk, spinach, banana, vanilla, almond butter, maca, maple syrup. This was the only thing I liked here, it tasted great! I got it without the maple syrup since I thought that would make it too sweet and felt like that was a pretty good decision. Its a pretty steep price for a smoothie that doesn't even have protein in it though...

Pitaya Smoothie ($8) - Pitaya, banana, strawberry, raspberry, coconut water. Tasted super tart and really didn't like this drink. Do not get.

Overall I had a really mediocre experience here, and I probably won't be back unless I swipe on a free Tinder brunch. The food is pretty photogenic, I'll give it that, but at a high cost.
author: Chelsea W.

description:
4.5 stars, rounded up.

I came here for lunch today with a colleague and literally had one of the best salads I've ever tasted - it was SO delicious and hearty! 

Ordered the Parker salad ($15 - kale, romaine, carrot, beet, granny smith apple, avocado, chickpeas, chicken breast, turkey bacon, radish, pickled onion, basil, creamy herb dressing), and it was a huge bowl! All the different flavors and textures (can we take a moment to admire the colors?!) went so well together, and everything tasted super fresh.

The portions here are definitely very generous so even though $15 for a salad is a bit pricey and quite bougie, I would for sure come back for the Parker salad and to try their bowls (served for breakfast, until 11:00am) and tartines which I've heard great things about also. Other than that, the service was good and the place is really clean - very solid brunch/lunch spot! Oh, and my colleague got the smoked salmon salad ($15) and she really enjoyed that too. 

Overall, very good food but a bit on the expensive side (-0.5 stars).
author: Angela C.

description: Pure class. Great little spot in Potrero Hill near the 22nd St station. Gentleman at the counter was extremely nice, seating was cozy, and my salad was fantastic. I had the Parker - a beautifully made salad with healthy portions and high quality ingredients. Plus they are open till 9pm. Definitely will be coming back here.
author: Sahand H.

description:
It is pretty rare that every single bite of something is TO. DIE. FOR!!!  I recently tried the Heirloom tomato tartine at Parker Potrero and it was just that - to die for!!! Holy cannoli, it was good. 

This is a small place with a few friendly people that work there. Seems like they do a substantial take out business, too. There are tables with chairs, a counter with bar stools and a few outside tables. 

My latte was great, too!!
author: Katie V.

description:
This place is cute, quaint and a great stop in Portero for some coffee! It clearly has great Yelp reviews about the food (I'll be back) but, I was in desperate need of caffeine on the day I visited.

They use sightglass coffee at this shop and the barista is well trained as my espresso was lovely. My friends ordered a couple cups of coffee and they were ready to go. One thing I noticed is that you can buy beans and have them ground for you to take home. I don't know a lot of coffee shops/restaurants that do that. 

I'll be back to try the food...
author: Benjamin F.

description: Loved the little outdoor seat & quick service for super tasty burrata heirloom tomato toast
author: Beth K.

description: The power cookie is phenomenal!! The lady behind the counter is personable,friendly and loves where works, it might be her restaurant. The juices are healthy and refreshing.
author: Nicole A.

description: We arrived at Parker right after it opened. I would categorize the decor as a modern industrial vibe. Thankfully we were some of the fist patrons for the day so we were seated immediately and received splendid service. The food was delicious. My poached eggs were done to perfection. Round of applause on the selection of enamelware as well.
author: Jacob N.

description:
I'm no stranger to Potrero Hill. I remember my days of living in my car and coming here to this neighborhood for skyscraping views of the city and one day dreaming of having my own place, enjoying a good meal, and even having a good cup of tea. 

Fast forward 7 years, Potrero Hill will always have a special place in my heart. 

Now, coming to Parker Potrero, this establishment is fairly new. I remember it being a previous voice studio. Now that it's here, it's been a lovely addition to the neighborhood. 

When you enter, the cafe is bright and airy with open style barstool seating with additional restaurant seating further to the back. Being 9 in the morning, they offered an extensive breakfast menu along with smoothies and fresh squeeze juices.

What I ordered:

Slowly recovering from a cold, I still had a bit of a cough. I went with the C-Boost juice to raise my immunity fighting capability. This lovely juice consisted of orange, grapefruit, lemon, lime, strawberry, and maple syrup. This tasted especially refreshing and gave me a quick pick me up. 

I also ordered the Green Dragon tea for comfort. 

Egg muffins - these little guys are a great concept, but could've used a teeny more salt (personal preference). The eggs were scrambled and then baked into a muffin tin and served alongside crispy potatoes and some toast, no jam, but they did offer honey. 

My most favorite, however, is their quinoa bowl. Filled with warm quinoa, turkey bacon, feta cheese, mushrooms, onion, kale, and a sprinkle of red pepper flakes, all topped with a perfectly poached egg. DELICIOUS! Make sure to mix it all together for that perfect bite!

Service was extremely friendly and quick. 

I'm really happy this cafe opened up and brought into fruition what I'd always thought I'd experience in the city!
author: Ann S.

description: High on my list for brunch or a snack. Parker Potrero exemplifies simplicity and quality. Simple menu, super fresh ingredients, fantastic tasting plates. They offer freshly made juices and smoothies, along with a killer espresso bar with Sightglass coffeee. Everything I ordered was done to perfection.
author: Kevin L.

description: Finding out a 2-hour wait at a restaurant a block away from this gem was not particularly a great start of our day. So we walked around with our empty stomachs but determined spirits and found this awesome breakfast spot! Cappucino was on spot while my other half enjoyed their green tea. The quiche was amazing he said while I had the Cubano tartine and it was amazing! Served with fresh greens and light balsamic dressing! It was unexpectedly good!
author: Danhill V.

description:
Was a bit disappointed given the excellent reviews.  Cute little spot, nice employees, but our dishes were lacking. 

-Egg Muffins:  these were the reason I came and they were a huge disappointment.  May have been a bad batch, but I was expecting something fluffy, while these were overcooked, a little dry and somewhat flavorless. 
-Cubano Tartine:  was ok, but not great...Proscuito was a little lacking in flavor, and the pork was too...the cheese came out a bit hard and not very 'melty' and delicious 
-Potatoes were ok 
-Espresso latte's were average
-Chocolate chip cookie was off the charts great; it was just and the friendly service that prevented a 2 star review.
author: Dave R.

description:
Love this place. Great location on 18th street in Potrero Hill. Cool modern interior.

I've only had two dishes: the caesar salad and the burrata shared plate. Both were really excellent. Its already one of my favorite salads in the city. Excited to try more on their menu. Employees and service were great too,
author: J. K.

description: Love this place, generous wine pourings, simple healthy and delicious cold and warm salads, tartines, and cookies.  Very reasonable prices and very friendly service.  Not to miss Potrero neighborhood gem.
author: Paul D.

description: Lovely little spot on a corner of 19th and Missouri. A great place to take a friend or even eat solo. Ordered the Asian chicken salad, and though it was well- seasoned and has good-for-you foods - quinoa and carrots and broccoli, it needs some crunch! Both small tables and bar seating (a bit uncomfortable - cold metal - not a good combo in freezing Sf). Will be back for takeout.
author: Cate R.

description:
Great place to grab a quick casual bite to eat for brunch! No wait when we went on the weekend. Open seating, so sit wherever a spot is open.

Food was simple, wholesome and tasty. Nothing crazy unique but everything was well-prepared and had solid flavors. Breakfast egg white sandwich was tasty although real bacon would be prefereed. Smoked salmon tartine hit the spot. Fresh juices and smoothies were great.

Best part was that everything was light and I didn't immediately want to go home and take a long nap afterwards.
author: Stephanie K.

description: Amazing brunch place. Food is great and the coffee is just out of the world. The best part is the people. They're super personable and fun to talk to! Really enjoyed sitting in the bar stool, watching drinks being made, and make small chats with the owner/baristas. There are so many varieties to try and I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Yoon K.

description: The salads are so good and super big -- at $14, I guess they should be but compared to other San Francisco restaurants it's a large portion. The quality of produce is great. My favorite dishes are: Parker Salad, Chinese Chicken Salad, and Veggie Quinoa Bowl. The tartines are good and large too, but the bread is a little hard, making it difficult to eat, even with a fork and knife. But overall very happy with this neighborhood spot.
author: Kate S.

description:
This is the first five star restaurant I've ever been to in my life! I ordered the smoked salmon tartine, and it was simply a manifestation of perfection! For some reason I expected the tartine to be dry and sourdoughy based on the way it looked, but it was actually crunchy on the outside and super soft on the inside. Typically I am not a fan of arugula at all because of the grassy taste it has, but the sourness of pickled onions and capers canceled that grassy taste and thus made the dish 10x more refreshing and enjoyable for me. Coupled with the crunch of the arugula and pickled onions, the fat of the salmon and spread kept the texture of the dish buttery and smooth; every bite felt like an explosion of various tastes and textures in my mouth.

I also got the hangover cure juice, which was pretty unique as well. Loved the hint of lavender.

The atmosphere of the place was also super amazing, filled with lots of sun and modern decorations. I can't wait to go back again!!!
author: Catherine C.

description:
Such a charming place. This is exactly what portrero hill needed! Fresh and wholesome ingredients, open and bright space, and lovely staff. 

The burrata and heirloom tomato tartine is delicious- the bread is freshly baked and sliced to order and slathered with bright green pesto and topped with meaty slices of tomato and melty burrata. 

The bowl came with with quinoa, avocado, roasted veggies, black beans, and a slow cooked red pepper chicken. Very flavorful and super filling. 

I'm excited to try the coffee and cakes next time! I have a feeling I'll be a regular :)
author: Ema H.

description:
Really great open faced sandwiches. I had the mushroom and my boyfriend had the cubano. The cubano was better because the cheese kept all the ingredients together - my mushrooms had to be eaten first before I could pick up the sandwich.

Their lemon bread is also really delicious, but their lemonade can be skipped. Parker is adorable, and I hope they stick around for a long time!
author: Christina S.

description:
Super cute cafe. Chill and no wait. Lovely decor, lovely service, and delicious food. I'd frequent even more if I lived in the neighborhood!

The banana bread was moist and they gave us cream when asked for (even though not a usual request ;) )
author: Victoria C.

description:
Their Parker salad with chicken is so so good. The dill dressing and the crunchy apples. Yum. But their Asian chopped with quinoa, I seriously could each that every day!

I went there for dinner with a couple friends and ordered a few things. Their daily soup, zucchini chipotle, was amazing. I'm bummed it's not a permanent menu item! But I'm also excited to try something new each visit.

We also had their heirloom tomato and buff mozz caprese tartine. Um whatever, that spinach pesto is SO good I was licking my fingers.

Lastly, get the Rickshaw cab or Barbera. Both reds are deelish. My first visit there I actually tried their rosé cava (aka pink bubbles) and took a pic of the label so I could drink it again and again.  :)
author: lindsey a.

description: I got the salmon salad. It was healthy and the lox was really good. The ingredients tasted really fresh. The chef and waiter were extremely welcoming. I forgot my wallet and they let me pay later. If you're looking for healthy clean food without a bunch of pretense this is a great choice.
author: K C.

description:
Love this place and have gone probably about 10 times since they opened earlier this year... but I pretty much get the same thing every single time. 

Don't know what to get? Get the heirloom tomato and burrata tartine. IT DOES NOT DISAPPOINT. 

Today I branched out and got the mushroom tartine. Fine. Once I got the quinoa bowl. Pretty great. But neither are anywhere as good as the heirloom tomato one. So I will continue to be boring and get that same thing every single time :)

Oh also the owners are super nice, and the place is very cute and clean on the inside. They just installed a couple benches and tables outside too which is great.
author: Amanda K.

description:
We had a lovely lunch on a grey day. Smoked salmon open faced sandwich and the Cubans open faced sandwich. They made avocado toast for our little one. 

The woman working the restaurant was LOVELY.

Thank you!!!
author: Lani N.

description: The folks here are always warm and friendly, and the food is tasty and not fussy (if that makes sense). I love the tartines and fresh juices. There is a chill, positive vibe to the place. This is my new favorite place in Potrero Hill.
author: Sylvia T.

description:
I love this place! 

Parker is a little gem in the neighborhood that makes a lovely destination for a dog walk on a warm day. Cruise up (or down) the hill with your pup, then take a meal break and enjoy a nice glass of wine at an outdoor table.

Winners that I've tried are the Green Pea Hummus Tartine, the Parker Salad, and the Asian Chopped Salad. I'm vegetarian and leaving the chicken out of the salads was not an issue in terms of flavor or heartiness. 

The neighborhood sorely needed a spot like this. It's casual dining with high-quality, delicious, and healthy food. Highly recommend.
author: Eve B.

description:
I had a great experience at Parker Potrero. Great coffee.  The food is yummy, fresh, and tasty with lots of vegetables and interesting ingredients.  My partner and I are vegetarian and they had numerous veg options on their brunch menu. The space is clean, airy, and pleasant with a great corner location, and the Sunday we visited it was busy and lively without being overly packed. 

The thing that brought me to Yelp though, was the customer service. The owner and our server were both very attentive and worked hard to make sure we were comfortable, settled, and happy with everything. We were there with our baby daughter and they were very thoughtful about accommodating her needs, bringing us a bowl for her snacks before we even pulled them out. They also let us hang out and wait for our friend, and gave the general impression that they wanted to make sure we had enough space to have an easy, relaxing time with the baby. 

From the way they were focused on us I could tell the place was pretty new and they were trying to secure repeat customers. This was fine with me - if I lived around the corner, and not half a Bay away, I'd be back every week. Instead I'm writing this review. Go check them out.
author: Julia M.

description: Cool little spot for breakfast or brunch..the egg muffins I had were light and fluffy with just the right amount of seasoning..they also serve good coffee drinks hot or cold
author: jonathan h.

description: Excellent spot for brunch on Sunday, and the best part is that you don't have to wait 2 hours! The staff is friendly, the view from the window seats is beautiful and the food is fresh and innovative! The egg white sandwich with pesto and turkey bacon rocks! Wonderful quaint spot in a lovely neighborhood.
author: R P.

description: Parker is a cute neighborhood cafe in Potrero Hill. A great corner location with a bright interior natural light and the  inside is simple and comfy. I had the smoked salmon tartine with a poached egg. Salmon was fresh and the egg was just right on point. The only thing I don't like is the bread beneath the salmon was too thick to chew that slightly affects the palate. My hubby had egg muffins. The flavor was good as well. Great place to have a casual brunch.
author: Victor W.

description:
This menu... ahhhh-mazing.  Exactly what I'm looking for. Egg white sandwich was the perfect amount of substantial, but not too heavy. My husband kept stealing bites from me so thank got it was a huge portion. His salmon tartine was extremely tasty as well. 
Everything is super fresh and in true SF fashion, fit for an instagram post (the food and restaurant itself is gorgeous).  The service was lovely as well! Great for a casual date or get together!
author: Erin G.

description: My friends and I tried this cafe last week for dinner and we loved it!  We were looking for a place with healthy food but also a place where we could have a glass of wine, and Parker Portero fit the bill perfectly.   The quinoa bowls were delicious, and the soup of the day was excellent.   The  portions were gernerous, and the food was fresh and very tasty.  I highly recommend if you're looking for a healthy, casual place to eat.
author: Kim C.

description: This was absolutely amazing brunch. My boyfriend and I are from Portland Oregon and were a little hungover and needed some food and we stumbled upon this place! I had a smoothie (so good and fruity) and the heirloom tomato toasts with a poached egg and avocado added! I was in heaven and it came with a side salad which was nice and light! A super sweet and welcoming staff and quick turnover for tables so we sat right away! Highly recommend!
author: Cali C.

description: Just up the street from PLOW and just as great with no lines and quick service! Very simple yet delicious brunch menu! Highly recommend their Tartines!! Really great sourdough bread! Love PLOW but so happy PARKER is available for same quality and atmosphere with little to no waiting in line to be served! Kind of regretting writing this because I have a feeling it won't be long before we have to wait in line at this place as well......
author: June R.

description:
Very disappointed. I went to Parker for an acai bowl and was disappointed to find it missing from their brunch menu. We ordered the egg muffins which were very dry and hard to eat. While the potatoes were under cooked and inedible. 
The only iced drinks on their menu were iced tea and juices. They would not serve us any iced lattes or coffee drinks. 
I was also confused to find Matcha served in their smoothie ingredients, but they don't serve any Matcha beverages. 
Don't waste your money on this place.
author: Bianca B.

description: Owner went out of their way to make sure I got a 5 star salad. I tried to pay for it and they wouldnt accept. Very kind, generous and outgoing. I'm ordering two more salads as we speak.
author: Michael M.

description: I got a open faced cuban sandwich.  It was pretty good.  My friend got a quinoa salad and killed it in record time.
author: Michael E.

description:
I have been excitedly waiting for this place to open up and it was well worth it. Not only does it look beautiful inside with the remodel but the food is so good. 
I had the Potrero Summer Salad, so fantastic and they didn't skimp on the amount. My boyfriend has the chicken salad and he loved his as well.
author: GIna K.

description:
Great addition to Potrero hill. Good breakfast and lunch menu with healthy juices, smoothies and some nice pastries as well.

Eaten here twice and both times I loved it.


Check it out !!
author: SIMON R.

description: Amazing good service! It's nice to see owners take pride in customer service and experience..
author: Sarah G.

description: Le yummy!  Delicious food, casual atmosphere, and friendly owners. I can think of nothing better after a hard day's work. Came here for a casual date night with the hubby and enjoyed the quinoa bowl from the specials menu plus the cubano tartine. Both were delicious and hearty. Coupled with a great glass of barbera...c'est magnifique!
author: Paola N.

description: Went there at sunset and had a delicious rose + the cubano tartine -- which was so flavorful! I also tried their signature Parker salad which was as colorful as it was delicious.
author: Mo P.

description: Very exciting to see this place finally open! I tried the Heirloom Tomato Tartine and it was delicious. Super fresh ingredients. Can't wait to try the rest of the menu and come for breakfast.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I was there for lunch with a friend ,
I really like the design and the natural light . Great corner cafe .
Food is organic fresh and delicious so delicious we order another Cuban tartine .
The people that work there are friendly and professional . 
I will definitely go back.
author: Nuit B.

description:
Just YUM.

Great atmosphere, very open and light. For as busy as it is it feels pretty laid back and not crowded so a big plus for that.

The food is delicious - it's all super fresh and well prepared. I had an open faced smoked salmon with herbed cream cheese sandwich. It came on a big slice of rustic bread, lots of fresh greens, pickled red onion, herbs and a small side salad. 

My friend had the Cubano sandwich and I don't eat meat so I'm going by how it looked, smelled and how he liked it. His plate was clean, like squeaky so we can say he liked it. Meat, pickles, cheeeeeeeze, a sauce that smelled really good. I don't know what else but it was piled high and pretty luscious looking.

His wife had the quinoa salad and finished it off. Which is impressive because it was a big sized salad. She's eaten there before and says the Parker Salad is phenomenal. That's my next order!

We split another sandwich, can't remember the name but it was avocado and cucumber ribbons and watercress and a harissa oil with some crunchy hemp seeds. Really really rich and refreshing.

Just go, you'll be really happy you did!
author: H. H. M.

description: I live around the area and decided to get the Green Butter Smoothie. Crazzzzzy good.
author: Kyle M.

description: I didn't find anything special here. Granted they don't have a full kitchen, but nothing compelling enough to come back for.
author: Bib G.

description: Parker is one of those new hidden gems in San Francisco! Skip the long lines and enjoy the deliciousness that is Parker Cafe, everything is made to satisfaction.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I came here on a Tuesday evening for a light dinner. 
I ordered their Chicken Salad Tartine, which was fresh, simple, and delicious. 

Although the food was good, it was a little pricey for what I got...but that's San Francisco for you.
author: Alisa R.

description: This place is great! I come here often for their Quinoa bowl. It is quaint, cozy and outdoor seating is a must. Service is superb, can't go wrong at Parker.
author: Corina G.

description: everything is good, but for the morning breaks=fast I think a little bit heavy but I really do like the food there and I am sure will be back
author: Yige X.

description:
The food was fine. The guy who took my order and served me was great. However, I had a less than pleasant experience with one of the female workers. There was an item missing from my meal that I was told the restaurant was out of. However the table that ordered a good bit after me had it. 

I went to the front to bring that up. From the second I flagged the issue the woman at the front had attitude and was aggressive. If she had just said 'I'm sorry about the confusion' I would have been fine. But instead she said 'I don't know what else to do for you. We refunded you your money What else do you want us to do?' 'Ma'am I didn't know you had refunded my entire meal to me.'  

The attitude wasn't necessary and considering I wasn't giving her attitude or being rude I'm confused as to why she was rude.

I'm hoping that the reason for her aggression has to do with her having a bad day instead what my gut thinks it really is about, the skin color of the guest.
author: Nnena U.

description: This place has really grown on me.  The first time I went here they'd just opened and I wasn't really feeling it.  Yet it wasn't bad so I decided to try it again.  The last 2 followup visits have been great.  I think they adjusted the menu a bit and more people are going here now so it feels more like a neighborhood spot.  The open faced sandwiches are really good and kind of generous in size.  Breakfast sandwich looked dank too.  The yogurt/granola bowl as really good and I typically don't order that kind of stuff.  Really nice staff, great coffee and I'll be back!
author: george c.

description: A delightful taste of healthy food in an inviting atmosphere. The shrimp bowl is absolutely amazing!
author: Cindy C.

description:
Had 2 experiences with Parker. 1st time went in for an early dinner. We were 2 of 5 customers. Lovely waitress, decent food. Love the interior, the windows onto the little neighborhood, the light. But the owner was surly, unpleasant and, I guess, bummed out cuz Chez Maman across the street was packed and his place was empty. Oh well. I thought "he's having a bad day". Second time i ordered food to go. Owner was "helping" me. Bad attitude. Unpleasant. Ungrateful -- and I was the only customer there.
Decent chicken salad. Nothing spesh. But well prepared. I'd go back if they got rid of that guy.
author: zina z.

description:
Walked over for late breakfast on Saturday, place was not too busy but not empty.  Ordered the egg muffins, which are good -- enjoyed them.

I would rate this place better, but I don't like the concept of having to tip at the time of order (what if service sucks?), and had to wait about 35 mins for the egg muffins.
author: Matt L.

description: All the food is super fresh and amazing! Love the clean atmosphere and excellent service. My favorite place to get breakfast and mimosas. The heirloom tomato tartine and breakfast sandwich are my personal favorite. 5/5!
author: Michael C.

description:
I went here for breakfast.  Suprised. Its good size food, tasty, and, fresh !

It's also clean.  I would go back.
author: Wendy C.

description: The tartines are tasty and we loved the Kids Fruity drink. Good for brunch or lunch. Friendly service. Cute. Takeout options.
author: Vicki L.

description: All the dishes have a spicy flavor, the chef clearly understands how to mix the ingredients together so great.
author: Genevieve S.

description: Such a great addition to Potrero Hill! Light, healthy and tasty food. Not overly crowded, with short waits. Great place to chill or have a conversation. I really like their quinoa bowl and I substitute out the turkey for avocado.
author: Christine P.

description: This place is perfect. What Potrero hill needed in terms of some middle ground open after hours. Great wine and salad if you're dining alone but great place to casually chat with a friend. Food is healthy, tasty and a nice breath of fresh air amongst some heavier restaurants in Potrero. My new staple.
author: Natalie L.

description: Clean, minimalist, beautiful place serving wines, coffee, cookies, tartines, and salads. It's slightly on the pricier side, but you're paying for legitimately good food, that airy feel, and the Portrero Hill view.
author: Joy Y.

description: I want to love Parker Cafe. I do love the concept - simple light healthy food, delicious coffee and juice to be had, not to mention beer and wine when I need my fix.  Loved the tartines I've tried, and the service has been, for the most part, above and beyond.  I did however have an awkward exchange one time when I stopped in for a coffee. It was a scorching SF day, like the ones we've been having lately that make you question whether we've been transplanted to socal, and I wanted an iced caffeinated beverage. Instead of simply saying we don't serve that drink, I was given an explanation along the lines of..."Iced coffee is bad for you, you shouldn't drink it. Though alot of people have been asking for it so we may serve it one day but not today." I ended up taking an iced tea to-go and feeling really strange about the lecture I got, which frankly made little sense. Not saying I won't go back, but it's not much fun to be 'splained at, along with being denied what you desire.
author: Archana P.

description: Update: the guys are now offering dinner as well: flat bread and bowls. This just keeps getting better!!!
author: Patric F.

description: Parker Cafe is the perfect addition to Potrero Hill. The food is delicious - so far I've tried the Egg White Sandwich, Parker Salad, Mushroom Tartine, and Egg Muffins. The same goes for the smoothies, coffees, and pastries. It is a great spot for breakfast and brunch, and also to swing by for a glass of wine and dinner. The owners and staff are very friendly and the ambience is awesome!
author: Michele R.

description: Had the potato pesto goat cheese flat bread , mushroom tartine, and rose.  Everything was super tasty.  Great service.  Awesome owners - very friendly and personable!  Highly recommend
author: simi h.

description: Great new place with very nice staff. The brunch is my favorite. The smoothies are great too although not cheap. Must try !!!!
author: theo v.

description: Such a nice place for breakfast on weekends -- incredible tartines, great juices, and excellent service.
author: Jackson M.

description: Great food and coffee, perfect vibes for getting a little work done. I love their flavored water, coffee was great, juice is fresh and reasonably priced. Main reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is their yelp page says they have wifi but they don't. Also, I had told them I wanted to get some almond butter toast and didn't realize there was a cutoff time for that, and I was 10 mins late when I decided to order it but they couldn't do it. Seems kind of silly. Anyway, overall 4 stars. Check it out.
author: Kristin S.

description: Im writing this review before trying any of the dishes. I litetally just orderded, but the service is outstanding so far. Helpful and polite. Okay lets see how polite the food is.
author: Shana W.

description: This café is absolutely darling. I must recommend the Chicken Salad Tartine.. it is super delicious and the portion was perfect. They have a pretty good wine selection, too. If you're in the area, I'd recommend stopping in. Definitely coming back, they're amazing!
author: Dan G.

description:
This corner cafe has a stunning view and a simple, splendid menu. I was there for the first time today and everyone along the counter I was sitting at was raving about their food: open face sandwiches, salads, juices.

Pro tip: order anything you want and add an egg on top. The eggs are masterfully poached and perfectly oozy. 

I can see myself becoming a regular for brunch, lunch or dinner. I'd order a glass of something sparkling and watch the sun set over the skyline at Potrero hill.
author: D Z.

description: I have nothing bad to say about this place.  The owner and his wife are amazing and their food is wonderful open face Tartines and wonderful service.
author: DocDarien D.

description: Great food, great atmosphere! Love the quinoa bowl and the classic Sightglass Drip coffee!
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Very cool café serving juices and salads and tartines in addition to pretty nice coffee ( Sight Glass)
The mozzarella and tomato tartine - like a caprese on sourdough with a nice pistou - with a n arugula salad, was tasty and good value. 
The cappuccino sized breve was perfectly crafted. 
And no annoying laptop campers yet moved in to kill the place. Fingers crossed. 

Bravo on your opening day!
author: Don R.

description: Love this place. I've been here once for lunch and once for dinner, both on weekdays. Easy to find a seat both times. Service was prompt. Ordered the mushroom tartine and the heirloom tomato tartine--both were fantastic, especially the mushroom tartine. It's a bit pricey, and if you come in the evening and want a "proper" dinner you might be a bit disappointed, but I'm a huge fan.
author: Andrew T.

description: Clean, great food, friendly people! I ordered Parker salad and it was fresh, filling and yummy.
author: Sepi S.

description: This place is awesome. Had the egg white sandwich and a green butter smoothie. Both were divine. Can't wait to go back, highly recommend.
author: Erika M.

description: wanted to love this place. the people are super sweet. i had the quinoa bowl, and i'm not sure if it's changed, but it was 80% quinoa. there were 4 pieces of turkey bacon and 5 pieces of kale. otherwise, it's a nice spot for breakfast or coffee!
author: Lilian W.

description: Definitely my favorite place to get brunch in SF. Me and my boyfriend come here EVERY Sunday morning. Their food is consistently fresh and tastes amazing. Their tomato tartine & watermelon mimosas are to die for. Plus the staff is so friendly and this cute cafe has a beautiful view of the city if you sit outside.
author: Elise B.

description: Definitely a place for good and delicious food , the owners are great and environment is relaxed
author: Oswaldo T.

description: The food was delicious and the serving sizes were generous, but not overwhelming. The service was excellent and the staff were quite friendly!
author: Steven O.

description: The best breakfast Tratines we had in a long time.   The mushrooms and goat cheese Tartine with poached egg exploded with flavors and the rustic, crunchy bread base was fantastic.   The smoked salmon Tartine was based on the same amazing bread and was the best I had in the city so far.
author: Yoram F.

description: Way overpriced salad - the portion was tiny and the chicken was barely perceptible. Came away with hunger and $17 less in my pocket.
author: Jessie M.

description: I've been eagerly awaiting the opening of Parker Cafe as I'm always excited when a new restaurant opens on the Hill, and my first visit(s) did not disappoint. The owners were there and couldn't have been warmer and more welcoming. I grabbed a coffee to go on their opening day (was pleasantly surprised they are serving Sight Glass) and a delicious cranberry pumpkin bread pastry. I returned for dinner the next day and was delighted by a great array of wines (I went with the Riesling which was really nice) and the Parker Salad. Loved the fresh ingredients and delicious creamy dill dressing. It was massive, so I felt the value was really great too. My fiancé had a glass of Sauv Blanc (yum) and the Cubano tartine. I couldn't believe how much meat you get. I also was lucky enough to try a bite with a zucchini pickle and it was awesome. I can't wait to go back and discover more of the menu!
author: William d.

description: On a stretch of Protrero known for hour long brunch lines, Parker cafe is a great addition. Open just 2 weeks the lines aren't there - yet. But it's a bright corner spot with a great view, delicious food and a beer & wine license. The Tartines (open face sandwiches) and salads are excellent. But I think it'll also make a great destination to grab a couple of glasses of wine and a light bite with friends at night. Add to that juices, pastries and coffee for a "grab and go" on the way to work and this should become a staple neighborhood joint for a good long time.
author: Andrew W.

description: Great food, drinks, and service in a casual environment. Try the tartines, coffee, salads, and pretty much anything else on the menu.
author: Anthony O.

description: After attempting, and failing, to get served at Papito, we walked around the corner and decided to try Parker. We were very happy that we did! Lovely salads and I also had a generous, tasty salmon tartine and a refreshing glass of sparkling rosé. The owner and his wife were both really nice and somehow managed to give us both space and good service. They are trying out new dinner menu items, which they will roll out in the next month or so. I am very picky about restaurants and we'll be back!
author: Palyn H.

description: This clean, well-lit space is a neighborhood gem. I came in for a weeknight dinner and had the most delicious heirloom tomato tartine and a glass of dry-as-bone rose. It was a treat that I hope to repeat soon... I hear the mushroom & Cubano are just as good. To boot, the service was outstanding.
author: Meghan C.

description: We had choice of untried places within a block of our car and decided to try Parker Cafe for its Saturday morning brunch.  The decor is crisp & clean.  Interesting view of the kitchen from the counter.  My "guamosa was a fun twist on the classic mimosa.  Hubby had bowl of oats & cream w berries.  I had the smoked salmon tartine that was fresh Some interesting brunch offerings passed by including an interesting "egg muffin"...things to save for next time.  A solid addition to Potrero Hill 18th Street corridor.
author: Kb H.

description: The mushroom tartine I had was amazing. Limited, but excellent, wine selection. Great little spot and cozy ambiance inside. Two thumbs up.
author: Tim C.

description: Delicious!  They just opened and no doubt the menu will continue to evolve but what a magnificent beginning!
author: Kelly D.
